alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Habersham; Hart; Stephens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 6:29PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Franklin, Stephens, southern Habersham, Hart, west central Anderson, southwestern Pickens and southern Oconee Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 629 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Clemson to 8 miles south of Clarkesville. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clemson, Toccoa, Seneca, Hartwell, Carnesville, Cornelia, Baldwin, Westminster, Reed Creek and Lavonia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
